intro: Toddalia angolensis, commonly known as the Angola thornapple, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, fleshy, orange-red fruits. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Toddalia angolensis is used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
